channel.title: Ammar M. Plumber
channel.description: Recent content in Philosophy on Ammar M. Plumber

item.title: A Flawed Case for Inequity Aversion — Revisiting the Criticisms of Binmore and Shaked (2010)
item.description: Assessing a debate about the methodology used to support a prominent behavioral model.

item.title: Does trade liberalization lead to more development?
Dopamine and impulsivity — more is less or more is more?
item.description: The article examines impulsivity and its connection to striatal dopamine function, indicating an inverted U-shaped relationship with treatment implications for impulse-control disorders.

item.title: Earnings premia of undergraduate single and double majors
item.description: This article examines the earnings advantage of college graduates with various major combinations over eleven years.

item.title: Information asymmetries and agricultural productivity in developing countries
item.description: Why asymmetric information causes market failure in this domain.

item.title: Paradox of the ravens
item.description: What is the relation of the paradox of the ravens to Goodman’s new riddle of induction? Ought they to be solved in the same way?

item.title: Progress in Neuroeducation — Mackey 2019
item.description: A survey of neuroscience research on education evaluation for students with learning disabilities. The talk covers normalization, compensation, and the influence of curiosity on educational outcomes.

item.title: Rewarding reading in school
item.description: Examining how rewards can undermine intrinsic motivation to do things.

item.title: Selective Perception in Infants — Saxe 2020
item.description: Rebecca Saxe's research shows that babies are not passive learners but actively exhibit preferences for social and informative stimuli from an early age.

item.title: The Phainomena in Aristotle's De Anima
item.description: Aristotle's philosophy of science in his treatise on the soul.

item.title: What is a law of nature?
What is constructive empiricism, and is it defensible?
item.description: And should one be worried by the hermeneutic circle?

item.title: What is scientific realism?
item.description: Evaluate the no-miracles argument in favour of this position. How does scientific realism fare in light of the threat of underdetermination, and the pessimistic meta-induction?

item.title: What is Thomas Kuhn’s picture of scientific practice?
item.description: In particular, how does he describe theory change? Should one be worried by the (alleged) incommensurability of scientific theories?

item.title: Neural unresponsiveness to fairness in MDD patients — state or trait?
item.description: A research proposal drafted by me and two other classmates for a graduate course in neuroeconomics taught by Joseph Kable at UPenn.
